meanings.definition: To move unsteadily back and forth
meanings.sent1: The toddler teetered on the edge of the playground equipment.
meanings.sent2: The old chair teetered on its last leg before finally collapsing.
meanings.sent3: The penguin teetered comically on the slippery ice.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job teetered on the brink of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The tower of blocks teetered precariously before tumbling down.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of uncertainty or instability
meanings.sent1: The economy teetered on the edge of a recession.
meanings.sent2: His emotions teetered between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent3: The plan teetered amusingly between success and failure.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship teetered on the verge of collapse.
meanings.sent5: The fragile peace agreement teetered dangerously on the brink of war.
